column7: Medibank is a health company working to deliver the best health and wellbeing experience for Australia. From our beginnings as a health insurer, we've grown to become more to millions of people across the country.

column6: Entities included in the organization's sustainability reporting
column7: Medibank entities include MHSI Pty Ltd, Medibank Health Solutions Telehealth, MH Investment Holding, MH Solutions Investment, Live Better Management, and Integrate Report.

column6: Reporting period, frequency, and contact point
column7: The sustainability report is part of Medibank's suite of reporting for the 2023 financial year Ã¢ÂÂ 1 July 2022 to 30 June 2023.
The Group restates the number of employees working at the company for FY21.
Pricewaterhouse (PWC) provides external assurance for the FY23 report.

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column13: Medibank's preventative health program offers personalised solutions tailored to individual health needs, promoting proactive measures to maintain wellbeing and prevent future health issues. Through comprehensive assessments and proactive interventions, Medibank empowers individuals to take control of their health and lead healthier lives.
column20: Preventative health programs, Health services, Better Health for Better Lives

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column13: Medibank's expansive no-gap network is one of the most extensive available, guaranteeing that customers incur no out-of-pocket expenses for doctors' services during hospital stays for knee or hip joint replacements, endoscopies, and select general surgeries. This system also enhances clarity for patients regarding surgery fees.
column20: No gap programs, Diversified insurance, wellbeing for Australia

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column13: Medibank's Clinical Homecare service delivers comprehensive medical support in the comfort of patients' homes, ensuring personalised care and convenience. Through skilled nursing care, medication management, and ongoing monitoring, Medibank's Clinical Homecare empowers patients to recover and manage their health in a familiar environment.
column20: Clinical homecare, Diversified insurance, wellbeing for Australia

column7: The total number of employees as of 30 June 2023 was 3,640.
The total number of part-time employees as of 30 June 2023 was 884.

The Group Committee consists of the Executive Risk Committee and Divisional Risk committees, Nomination Committee, Procurement Governance Committee, Benefits Change Governance Committee, Pricing Committee, and Clinical Governance Committee.

column6: Nomination and selection of the highest governance body
column7: The Nomination Committee oversees the nomination and selection process for the highest governance body at Medibank.

column6: Chair of the highest governance body
column7: Mike Wilkins is the Chairman for the FY23 reporting period.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in overseeing the management of impacts
column7: The Medibank Board established a solid approach to effectively manage environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues, including climate risks and opportunities. The Board's oversight and management's role in assessing and managing climate-related risks and opportunities are described opposite.

column6: Delegation of responsibility for managing impacts
column7: The Board is responsible for providing strategic guidance and effective oversight of Medibank's operations and management. Five standing Board committees have been established to support the Board in managing its corporate governance responsibilities.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column7: The Medibank Board holds overall responsibility for sustainability and corporate responsibility issues, while other Board committees have input into environmental, social and governance matters.

Each director provides periodic updates of their interests, positions, associations and relationships, and all directors must keep the Board advised on an ongoing basis of any interest that could conflict with those of Medibank.

Medibank aims to create an environment where people are encouraged to speak up if something doesn't look right and where they feel safe if they do. If anyone has concerns, they can report them through several different channels.
column14: 4 whistleblower contact was made during the year 2023.

column6: Collective knowledge of the highest governance body
column7: The Nomination Committee regularly reviews the Board's balance of skills, experience, independence, knowledge and diversity. It is committed to ensuring that the directors have the appropriate skills mix. The evolution of the Board's mix of skills and diversity is a long-term process and must reflect the current and emerging challenges for the organisation.

column6: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
column7: The Nomination Committee reports on and evaluates the performance of the Chair, Board, committees, and individual directors to the Board. The assessment is conducted annually, either through an internal review process or an external process.

The Group remuneration strategy has been developed to recognise our people for responsibly executing Medibank's strategy, role-modelling behaviours and achieving business objectives that increase value for our customers, shareholders, and the community. Supporting this strategy, our remuneration framework reinforces our risk management framework, linking individual performance and behaviours with achieving business objectives that support Medibank's long-term financial success.
Medibank's remuneration components include long-term incentives, short-term incentives and fixed payments.
The total remuneration for key management personnel for FY 23 was $8,012,750.

"Medibank's sustainability strategy is anchored to our business strategy and is explicitly linked to our purpose of Better Health for Better Lives. It is embedded in our business and in the decisions we make every day."

column13: The Live Better program incentivises customers to prioritise their health and wellbeing. This year, we surpassed our goal for new enrollments, with membership reaching nearly 700,000. Additionally, we extended the program to include customers on overseas worker and visitor policies, enabling them to earn and utilise rewards.
column20: Live Better Program, Diversified insurance, wellbeing for Australia

column13: Medibank's Covid Give Back program demonstrates our commitment to supporting communities during challenging times by assisting those affected by the pandemic. Through various initiatives and contributions, we strive to alleviate burdens and foster resilience in the face of Covid-19.
column20: COVID give back program, Medibank and AHM customers, COVID financial support\t

column7: Medibank continues to provide full support and work collaboratively with APRA on the remediation program to tackle cybersecurity risk.

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column7: Medibank developed many new processes during the initial stages of the event to respond quickly and accurately to customer concerns. The Group also introduced additional health and wellbeing activities to support our complaint handlers during this challenging time.
All employees undertake compulsory compliance training each year to ensure they understand our regulatory obligations and what this means for their role.
Medibank is a member of the Australian Nursing and Midwifery Federation, the Community and Public Sector Union and the United Services Union.

column13: Medibank's Customer Cash Give Back initiative reflects our dedication to rewarding our customers' loyalty and support. Through this program, we provide financial incentives to our valued customers, demonstrating our appreciation for their continued trust and partnership.
column20: Customer cash giveback, premium increase deferral, AHM extras limit

column13: Medibank's Monthly Sustainability Communications initiative underscores our commitment to transparency and environmental stewardship. We strive to inform stakeholders about our sustainability efforts through regular updates and engagement, driving awareness and accountability for a healthier planet.
column20: Monthly sustainability communications, extending risk assessments, educating our partners

column13: Medibank's Customer Channels team ensures seamless and efficient communication between the company and its customers. With a focus on innovation and customer satisfaction, the team consistently explores new channels and strategies to enhance the overall customer experience.
column20: The customer Channels team, Geelong in Victoria, customer supports

column7: Medibank has several enterprise bargaining agreements operating within our Group. The number of employees covered by enterprise agreements has decreased in FY23.
